N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 521.5 - Program and fiscal requirements

State Regulations
(a) Local governments, voluntary agencies, companies and sponsors or proposed
incorporators may apply for State aid grant, and/or HFA mortgage
loan. (b) A completed application
must be submitted to the OMH in the format and on forms prescribed by the
commissioner. (c) A certificate of
need application must be submitted pursuant to OMH regulations and
conditionally approved prior to the payment of State aid grant funds. (d) The applicant must agree to be bound by, and execute the documents necessary to insure compliance with the assurances
contained in section
521.10
of this Part. (e) The applicant will comply with the
following fiscal and bookkeeping requirements: (1)

The applicant for a State aid grant is
required to establish and maintain accounting and fiscal records in a manner
approved by the OMH to reflect the receipt and expenditure of funds allotted
and paid for capital costs. Similar suitable accounts shall be maintained to
show receipt and disbursement of Federal, local or other funds used for
matching purposes. (2)

The
applicant will demonstrate to the OMH, by submission of adequate documentation
that sufficient funds will be available to the applicant to enable the
applicant to meet the nonstate aid grant share, as provided for under these
regulations, of the capital cost of the project. (3)

The applicant will demonstrate to OMH
that sufficient funds will be available when the capital portion of the project
is completed for effective use of the facility for the purposes for which the

State aid grant has been provided. (4)

The OMH shall have access to the books, records and physical site of any facility receiving a State aid
grant. (f) The applicant
for a Housing Finance Agency mortgage loan must, in addition to the
requirements imposed by the OMH, comply with any and all additional
requirements imposed by the Housing Finance Agency. (g) The applicant must enter into and execute
such agreements that, as determined by the OMH, are necessary to secure the
appropriate use of the State aid grant or Housing Finance Agency mortgage
proceeds, as provided for in section
521.13
of this Part. Notes
